metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44790 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A carefully crafted request body can cause a buffer overflow in the mod_luamultipart parser (r:parsebody() called from Lua scripts). The Apache httpdteam is not aware of an exploit for the vulnerabilty though it might bepossible to craft one. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.51 andearlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.21').
